summary: This document details the transport and treatment of Jeffrey E. Epstein following his arrest on July 6, 2019. It describes interactions between Epstein and FBI Special Agents Elizabeth Jensen and Connor Veres, including inquiries about his health and well-being during transport to the federal facility.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the subject of the investigation and was arrested on July 6, 2019. He is described as being cooperative during transport and declining medical assistance.

persons.name: Elizabeth Jensen
persons.context: Special Agent Elizabeth Jensen was involved in the transport of Jeffrey E. Epstein and engaged him in conversation regarding his health and needs.

persons.name: Connor Veres
persons.context: Special Agent Connor Veres assisted in the transport of Jeffrey E. Epstein and was present during the interactions described in the document.

connections.description: Elizabeth Jensen, as an FBI Special Agent, was responsible for the transport and welfare checks of Jeffrey E. Epstein during his custody.
Connor Veres, as an FBI Special Agent, was involved in the transport of Jeffrey E. Epstein and assisted in ensuring his needs were met.

events.title: Transport of Jeffrey E. Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein was transported by FBI agents to 26 Federal Plaza following his arrest at Teterboro Airport.

events.title: Transport to US Court House
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein was transported from the US Bureau of Prisons to the US Court House for further legal proceedings.

locations: US Bureau of Prisons, MCC facility
US Court House, 500 Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, at Teterboro Airport.
During transport, Epstein was asked about his medical and psychological needs, to which he responded negatively.
Two pairs of handcuffs were used for Epstein's transport to ensure comfort.
Epstein was provided with water and snacks during his custody but declined to eat.
On July 8, 2019, Epstein was transported to the US Court House, where he expressed appreciation for the treatment he received.
